Name: Picador
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lime zest twist.
Express lime zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: The name might be more masculine, but it is still a classic Margarita. This 2:1:1 recipe is a touch on the sour side for most so you may want to add a 5ml (1 bar spoon) of agave or sugar syrup.
History: Yes, you're right! This drink is exactly the same as a classically proportioned Margarita . It was first published in William J. "Billy" Tarling's 1937 Café Royal Bar Book , 16 years before the first written reference to a Margarita.
Nutrition: One serving of Picador contains 152 calories
